dialogues.text: The figure below, as Kubell's gunshot ROARS, echoing huge in the shaft, and a slug rips through the jumpsuited leg. The figure doesn't stir.

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON
dialogues.text: staring down the shaft, raises his mike again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Johnny, hold your fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small army of cops is now covering the elevator doorway from both sides. Tate crouches next to the SWAT COMMANDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio mike) We're coming into the car, we're  opening the hatch. Watch his hands.  Any fire will come from us. Affirm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT commander hands his radio to another cop, then l at Tate. A long, tense moment. Then he waves a signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as we follow a picked team of four SWAT cops, in full bod armor, rushing into the elevator car. Two men move to the corners, aim assault rifles at the ceiling. A third man s a stepladder in place, and the fourth man, armed with a b Colt, hurries up the ladder and unclips the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the service hatch, as the hinged cover drops open, and body tumbles through, dangling head first, until it's cau at the waist. We see the back of the head.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. TATE
dialogues.text: shoulders through the SWAT cops for a closer look. He tur towards the SWAT commander, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Pembry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rear chamber, a young EMS ATTENDANT is braced agai the vehicle's sway. Behind him, the stretchered form of h patient, and, through a curtained opening, the driver. SO of the siren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio mike) He's comatose, but his vital signs  are good. Pressure's 130 over 90...  Yeah, 90! Pulse 85...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, in slightly BLURRED FOCUS, the bloody figure  sits slowly upright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His convulsions have stopped, but  he's got so much loose skin on his  face, it's hard to tell if -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he stops, becoming aware of a strange HISSING. H turns, puzzled...

dialogues.speaker: THE POCKETKNIFE BLADE
dialogues.text: in Lecter's fist, flashes high in the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE on the EMS ambulance, as it races along norm its SIREN blazing, the heavy flow of traffic parting to m way for it. Then suddenly it begins to weave erratically, changing la before drifting dangerously to a full stop, almost side-w Cars swerve to avoid hitting it, HONKING angrily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on the stopped ambulance. After a long, still moment, the wind-shield wipes come on, incongruously, then stop. Then the SIREN is shut OFF, and the flashers. The ambulance st rolling again - at first jerkingly, then with increasing  speed. We follow it for several more moments, until is pa and we LINGER on...

dialogues.speaker: BIG GREEN INTERSTATE SIGN
dialogues.text: ...that reads "Memphis International Airport / 2 miles."

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH AMBULANCE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: Dr. Lecter's face is slowly REVEALED, as he wipes across with a fistful of gauze, tossing it aside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE, rushing with dizzy swiftness over the prair over waving grasses... a long passage... before we come a last to the girl Clarice, sitting with her lamb, hunched despair. She rises, her face tear-stained, and turns from us. Holding the lamb, she starts back the way she came...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE, very rapid, down this road... coming at las to a stopped highway patrol car. Clarice, with her lamb, standing in the car's headlights. She starts wearily towa the sheriff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE ANGLE - sweeping rapidly DOWN into the barnyard tow the arriving highway patrol car, as it stops... RUSHING t the little girl as she steps from the car, holding the la The dark figure of the rancher ENTERS FRAME. As he roughl takes the lamb from her, we HOLD on a CLOSEUP of her face stunned, blank. She EXITS FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE - CLARICE'S POV as she walks towards the ope barn doorway... It looms CLOSER... The rancher is reveale a shadowy figure, pinning the lamb on the killing table. knife hand sweeps up high, then holds... He turns TO CAME his face breaking into the light - and it is the face of Lecter. He smiles his terrible smile at the young Clarice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE - coming in very CLOSE on the adult Clarice' face - shocked, devastated - as she stands alone by the  dangling receiver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a shower head, as water suddenly blasts out. Cla moves INTO SHOT, as she scrubs her face and hair compulsi almost desperately, unable to get clean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found the ambulance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice is hunched on her cot, in a bathrobe, her hair we The Buffalo Bill case file, a thick bundle, rests by her  feet. Ardelia hovers anxiously nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the parking garage at Memphis  airport. The crew was dead. He killed  a tourist, too. Got his clothes,  cash... By now he could be anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice looks up. Her eyes are red-rimmed with exhaustion and something close to despair. She reads Ardelia's thoug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He won't come after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) It would be rude. And he wouldn't  get to ask any more questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardelia sits beside her, touches her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice - you did the best anybody  could have for Catherine Martin. You  stuck your neck out for her and you  got your butt kicked for her and you  tried. It's not your fault it ended  this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst part - the thing that's  making me crazy - is that Bill is  right in front of me. Only I can't  see him... (touching the case  file) Lecter said, everything I need to  catch him is right here, in these  pages...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lecter said a lot of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) He's here, Ardelia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardelia stares back at her. SOUND UPCUT - the low throb of a washing machine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice has spread out the case file across two washing  machines. Ardelia, cross-legged on a dryer, studies anoth pile of forms. Nearby is their laundry basket, detergent  box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Hey, is this Lecter's handwriting?  She holds up the map, with its  location markings for the kidnapping  and body dump sites. Clarice takes  it, looks.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAP
dialogues.text: with newly inked words in Dr. Lecter's precise, elegant h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice, doesn't this random  scattering of sites seem overdone to  you? Doesn't it seem desperately  random - like the elaborations of a  bad liar? Ta... Hannibal Lecter.

dialogues.speaker: TWO SHOT
dialogues.text: as Clarice looks up at Ardelia, puzzled but excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Desperately random." What does he  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not random at all, maybe. Like there's  some pattern here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there is no pattern. There's no  connection at all among these places,  or the computers would've nailed it!  They're even found in random order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, except for the one girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) What girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one that was weighted down. Where  is she...? Fred something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They search among the inserts. Clarice finds the graduati photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fredrica Bimmel, from Belvedere,  Ohio. The first girl taken, but the  third body found... Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause she didn't drift. He weighted  her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? He didn't weight the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice moves, on fire, unable to keep still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first, what the hell did Lecter  say about... "First principles," he  said. Simplicity... What does this  guy do, he "covets." How do we first  start to covet? "We covet what we  see -"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, turns. She grabs the photo of Fredrica from  Ardelia, stares at it. She looks up, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "- every day."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Hot damn, Clarice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew her...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice and Crawford are seated in front of Director Burk who's at his desk. Another chair is empty, because Krendl is pacing. All four are nearing their boiling points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he lives in this, this  Belvedere, Ohio, too! Maybe he saw  her every day, and killed her sort  of spontaneously. Maybe he just meant  to... give her a 7-Up and talk about  the choir. But then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starling -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then he had to cover up, make  her seem just like all the rest of  them. That's what Lecter was hinting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The market in Lecter hints is way  down, today, okay? I've got two good  men dead in Memphis, and three civilians. I've got -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell's fault is -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a U.S. Senator who's half out of  her head because her daughter's going  to be murdered today! And all because  of your mind games with fucking  Lecter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hadn't interfered, he'd still  be in custody in Baltimore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sent in a green recruit, with a phony goddamn offer -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just trying to cover your ass  for letting him escape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THAT'S ENOUGH! All of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence, as they all struggle to regain composure. Crawford, who was at the point of striking Krendler, fina retakes his seat. Burke looks sadly at Crawford and Clari

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very reluctantly) Starling, I'm afraid I have no choice.  You're suspended from the Academy. (Crawford starts to  interrupt) Not another word! (to Clarice) This is pending a reevaluation of  your fitness for the service. I  promise you'll get a fair hearing. (pause) Jack... you're ordered to take  compassionate leave. You'll spend  the rest of the day briefing the  AG's office, then transfer command  of the task force, effective by 1800  hours. (beat) I'm sorry, Jack... Go home. Take  care of Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice and Crawford stare back at him, drained. A long a very painful silence. Not even Krendler looks happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice and Crawford walk out slowly, stand there a momen not knowing what to say, not wanting to face each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All his victims are women... His  obsession is women, he lives to hunt  women. But not one women is hunting  him - except me. I can walk in a  woman's room and know three times as  much about her as a man would. (beat) I have to go to Belvedere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard them. I don't have that  authority anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do until six p.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her sadly. He looks, for the first time,  defeated, old beyond his years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohio is cold ground. Picked over,  ten months ago. Our people worked  it, so did the locals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not from this angle. Not thinking  he knew her. You've got to send me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Bureau for 28 years, Starling. I  won't disobey orders, not even now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just became a private citizen.  I can go anywhere I want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With ID and a gun...? Impersonating  a federal agent is a felony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to kill her, Mr. Crawford.  This morning, or maybe at noon, but  today, and Belvedere's our last  chance. I'm flying there, right now,  unless you stop me. You want my ID?  Here - take it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her, a long moment. Catherine's life. Claric passion, and future. His loyalty to the Bureau. Call it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out his wallet) There's about $300 here... And a  hotline code number. They'll patch  you through to me, wherever I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises her hand to him. She wants to touch him face, his neck, but can't. Finally she takes his money and card

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches, frightened for both of them, as she backs awa smiles, then turns, racing towards the surveillance van. SOUND UPCUT - the scratchy recording of Fats Waller SINGI as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the needle of the Victrola, on the spinning reco as Mr. Gumb's fingers lift away. MUSIC continues in  background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Preeeeecious...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the moth cage, as Mr. Gumb's fingers search thro the humus, and find a plump new cocoon, lifting it out. T door of the cage is left open, and one or two of the adul moths flutter out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, come on Precious! Busy  busy day today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a clean towel, beside the sink. The cocoon is ge placed in readiness alongside four shiny skinning knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma's gonna be sooo beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a stainless steel Colt Python, with a six-inch  barrel, as the cylinder is spun, and the hammer gets a  practice cock. The metallic CLICK is deep and loud. A not of alarm has entered Mr. Gumb's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come here this minute, you little  scamp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE on Mr. Gumb, wearing the kimono, as he walks th his sewing workroom. His back is to us; he is looking  anxiously under the furniture. He stops, straightens.  Genuinely scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious...?

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE PIT OPENING
dialogues.text: Towards Mr. Gumb, as he stops at one of the doorways of t oubliette chamber. He stares inside; his face in shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the distant bottom of the pit, we hear Catherine's v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd down here you sack of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gumb's fist flies to his mouth, and he sags against t doorframe. A little groan escaped him; the dog answers wi a series of YIPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Mr. Gumb's dark shape leans cautiously over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: crouched to one side, clutching the dog to her chest. See Mr. Gumb, the dog squirms frantically, BARKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a telephone. Lower it down to  me. Do it now, mister! I don't want  to have to hurt this little dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on Mr. Gumb, as, with a cry of fury, he whips the Colt fr inside his kimono. The muzzle gleams as he takes aim. Catherine yanks the dog up, into his line of fire, scream at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shoot motherfucker you better  kill me quick or I'll break her  fucking neck, I swear to God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wails) Nooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucking the dog under one arm, she grabs its muzzle, twis the head. The dog WHINES piteously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, you son of a bitch! Back  off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Mr. Gumb cries out again - a terrible, inarticulate sc of rage and anguish. But then he slowly lowers his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Catherine, as she maintains her grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better... Now get me a live  telephone. Get a long extension and  lower is down here... And you better  do it fast, too, 'cause I think her  leg's broken. She's in pain, mister,  she needs a vet.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: stares down at her, a long beat, breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she's in pain? You don't  know what pain is. But you're going  to find out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And abruptly he vanishes. SOUND of his footsteps, rushing off.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: begins shaking, hands and arms twitching uncontrollably. hugs the little dog tight to her chest, buries her face i its fur, sobbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE as a rented sedan pulls up to the curb, stops. After a moment Clarice climbs out, a bit stiffly. Double- checking this address, she glances up from a folded stree map to -

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD, THREE-STORY WOODEN HOUSE
dialogues.text: in a row of similarly shabby homes, all backing onto a na river. A path of boards, laid over mud, leads back along  this house towards the brown water. SOUND of hammering fr there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awesome huddle of pigeon coops sprawls by the brackish water. The birds' COOING mixes with the HAMMERING. A tall gaunt man in a knit cap is obsessively pounding nails int new coop.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: approaches him, and the man lowers his hammer. He has red rimmed eyes of watery blue. His face is deeply seamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bimmel...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares back at her, warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE - LOOKING DOWN as Mr. Bimmel leads Clarice up steep flight of steps. The bannister is worn, sags a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know nothin' new to tell ya.  The police been back here so many  times already... Fredrica went into  Columbus on the bus to see about a  job. She left the interview OK. She  never come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice pauses, at the landing, to look at a framed photo the familiar graduation portrait. Others pictures show  Fredrica as a young girl, toddler, infant - plump and hop at each age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her room's how she left it. Just  shut the door when you're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARICE'S POV - MOVING SLOWLY as she takes in flowery chi curtains... posters of Madonna and Blondie... a twin bed, with worn, stuffed animals on the pillow... a big sewing  machine in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: turns, absorbing nuances. There is loneliness here, an ec of desperation under this steeply pitches ceiling. A shri MEOW, and she looks down...

dialogues.speaker: BIG TORTOISESHELL CAT
dialogues.text: is rubbing against her ankles.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: picks up the cat, scratches behind his ears. She glances

dialogues.speaker: IN A FULL-LENGTH MIRROR
dialogues.text: she and the cat stares back at their own reflection...

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: sitting at the desk, turns the pages of a high school  yearbook. The cat is curled on her lap...

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: kneeling by the old Decca record player, flips through LP and singles. The cat has wandered off...

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: pulling a string to light up the closet. She is surprised and intrigued to see an extensive wardrobe, groaning from the rod. A shelf above the rod is stacked high with sewin supplies, in clear plexiboxes. She flips through the hang clothes, pulls out one dress, on its hanger, for a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRESS
dialogues.text: is very big, to fit Fredrica, but beautifully cut. Some o the seams still look unfinished. She turns it around, see blue tissue dressmaker's pattern still pinned to the back

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING THE SEWING MACHINE
dialogues.text: as Clarice turns, looks towards it. She hangs the dress o the closet door knob, crosses to sit at the machine. She  takes off its dust cover. She runs one hand over the cool metal, as a taunting memory forms in her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy wants to change, too, Clarice.  But there's the problem of his size,  you see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, looks again at the unfinished dress. Suddenly straightens, her attention riveted by something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the printed pattern, down at the lower back of the out dress, are two bold black triangles. We RUSH CLOSER to th shapes, before jumping back to -

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: who stares at them, starting to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if he were a woman, he'd have  to be a big one...

dialogues.speaker: IN FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: those missing triangles of skin on the dead girl's back, the funeral home in West Virginia...

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: as she jumps to her feet, with a fierce joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sewing darts. You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice paces, in an exuberant rush, amidst the worn  furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) He's making himself a "woman suit,"  Mr. Crawford - out of real women!  And he can sew, this guy, he's really skilled. A dressmaker, or a tailor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starling -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why they're all so big -  because he needs a lot of skin! He  keeps them alive to starve them awhile -  to loosen their skin, so that -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starling, we know who he is! And  where he is. We're on our way now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause; surprised) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawford sits at a communications console, with Burroughs in headphones, by his side. This forward section of the c is crammed with hi-tech equipment, all lit up and WHIRRIN Through a window we see clouds, part of the jet's wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into speaker phone) Calumet City, edge of Chicago. I'll  be on the ground in 45 minutes with  the Hostage Rescue Team. I'm back in  charge, Starling. He's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Clarice reacts; her happiness for Crawford is tinged w disappointment at being so suddenly out of the hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Sir, that's great news. But how -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns Hopkins finally came up with a  name for us. We fed him into Known  Offenders, and he came up cherries. (takes a paper from  Burroughs) Subject's name is "Jamie Gumb," AKA  "John Grant." Lecter's description  was accurate, he just lied about the  name.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE JET
dialogues.text: from the rear of the cabin forward, as we slowly PASS the twelve-man HRT. They're seated in full gear, hardshell ar quietly checking and rechecking their bulging cases of we silencer automatics, shotguns, stun grenades...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Gumb's a real beauty. Slaughtered  both his grandparents when he was  twelve, and did nine years in juvenile  psychiatric. Where, Starling, he  took vocational rehab, and learned a  useful trade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sewing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a bow. Customs had some paper  on his alias. They stopped a carton  two years ago at LAX - live  caterpillars from Surinam. The  addressee was "John Grant." Calumet  Power & Light's given us two possible  residences under that alias. We're  hitting one, Chicago SWAT's taking  the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Chicago's only about 400 miles from here. I could be there in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Starling, there isn't time. And  you've still got crucial work to do  in Ohio. We want him for murder, not  kidnapping. I'm counting on you to  link him to the Bimmel girl, before  he's indicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice tries hard to swallow her disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir... I'll do my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause; gently) Starling - you've earned back your  place in the Academy. We never  would've found him without you, and  nobody's ever going to forget that.  Least of all me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Thank you, sir...

dialogues.speaker: CRAWFORD
dialogues.text: switches off, feeling bad for her. On the console near hi the fax machine starts to CHATTER. He turns, looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an emerging sheet, as Gumb's face is printed out. We see  just his hair, then the top of his forehead, before we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice walks slowly across the yard, absorbing all this  news, before suddenly leaping into the air and pumping he fist in triumph, with a happy yelp. Then she sees -

dialogues.speaker: MR. BIMMEL
dialogues.text: staring at her in surprise. He sits by his coops, smoking

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: somewhat embarrassed, crosses over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bimmel... did Fredrica ever  mention a man named Jamie Gumb, from  Calumet City? Or John Grant? (he shakes his head) Did she know any men that sew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sewed for everybody. Stores,  ladies, whatever. I don't know about  men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was her best friend, Mr. Bimmel?  Who'd she hang out with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI turbojet is parked, its gangway down. Crawford,  Burroughs, and the HRT squad, carrying their bags of weap CLATTER rapidly down the metal steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaked me out. Get your skin peeled  off, is that a bummer...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SAVING & LOAN - BELVEDERE - DAY STACY HUBKA - short, perky, early 20's - sits nervously a her desk, talking to Clarice, who jots in her notebook. I the background. beyond them, bank tellers, lines of waiti customers, MUZAK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said she was just rags, like somebody -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stacy, did Fredrica ever mention a  man named Jamie Gumb? Or John Grant? (Stacy shakes her  head) Do you think she could've had a friend  you didn't know about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. She had a guy, I'da known,  believe me. Sewing was her life, she  was really great at it. Poor Freddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever work with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure, me'n Pam Malavesi used to  help her do alterations for old Mrs.  Lippman. Lots of people worked for  her, she had the business from all  these retail stores? But she was  like, totally old, it was more'n she  could handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does Mrs. Lippman live? I'd  like to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died. She went to Florida to  retire, like two years ago? She dies  own there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice reacts, disappointed at the ending of this trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; shyly) Is that a pretty good job, FBI agent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get to travel around and stuff?  I mean, better places then this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddie was so happy for me when I  got this job. This - toaster  giveaways, and Barry Manilow on the  speakers all day - she thought this  was really hot shit. What did she  know, big dummy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly she's fighting tears. Clarice reaches to hug her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ANGLE on what appears to be, at first, a calm, ordin neighborhood of working class two- and three-story houses But the street is strangely quiet, deserted. After a few moments, we become aware of movement - armed, dark-clad figures creeping swiftly and in silence from sh to garage corners, from parked cars to porches, appearing and then disappearing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Mr. Gumb, as he settles a big pair of infra-red  night-vision goggles over his eyes. Moths flutter past hi face. His mouth is set in a grim line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An HRT cop, prone beneath a hedge, is joined by a 2nd HRT Cop, who throws himself to the grass beside him. They bot take aim with their scoped rifles at -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door of a big, nearby, split-level house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a fuse box, as Mr. Gumb reaches in, flips a swit The lights go out. SOUND of a second switch, and the cell is bathed in a green glow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little boy, riding his tricycle in his driveway, is sud startled to find himself staring into the grim face of -

dialogues.speaker: A MEMBER OF THE HRT
dialogues.text: crouched by his garage, armed to the teeth. As the little boy starts to cry, the cop pulls him into the shadows,  covering his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gumb, in his kimono and goggles, creeps silently thro his workrooms - knees bent, painted toes places ever so  delicately, the Colt held aloft - as more moths flutter p him in the eerie light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A florist's van turns the corner, comes slowly down the s and stops at the curb in front of the split-level. The dr in a gray deliveryman's uniform and cap, climbs out of th cab, walks briskly to the panel door, on the street side the van, and slides it open. He leans in, comes out with long, thin red-ribboned floral box, starts calmly towards the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. GUMB'S POV - MOVING ANGLE on the top of the oubliette glowing green circle in the dark, as it draws closer and  closer... and then Catherine comes INTO VIEW, at the bott of the pit. She is crouched, exhausted, staring straight at him - but she can't see him in this infra-red darkness Precious is curled into her stomach, asleep. The futon is to Catherine's waist, but there's a clear shot at her hea and neck.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: Looking down at her, smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE on the "deliveryman," seen from behind, as h mounts three steps to the split-level's front porch. Tuck into the small of his back if a 9 mm. automatic.

dialogues.speaker: CRAWFORD AND BURROUGHS
dialogues.text: have slipped out of the van, and are crouched behind it n with drawn guns, watching tensely as -

dialogues.speaker: THE "DELIVERYMAN"
dialogues.text: settles the floral box in the crook of his left arm, reac out with his right hand towards the buzzer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, savoring the moment, Mr. Gumb aims the big Colt,  which is already cocked, using both hands... He is just a to squeeze the trigger, when we hear his DOOR BUZZER,  surprisingly loud and close by. He turns, startled, and s

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY BLACK METAL BOX
dialogues.text: the extension buzzer, mounted high on the wall, which is  making the hideous, grating JANGLE. It finally stops, but not before waking Precious, who starts frantically BARKIN off screen, as -

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: raises his gun again, spinning back towards -

dialogues.speaker: THE PIT BOTTOM
dialogues.text: where Catherine, hearing but still not seeing him, quickl yanks the futon over both herself and the dog. Instantly two of them become one squirming, indistinguishable mass.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: bites his lip, his aim wavering, as he can't decide where safely place his shot. The maddening BUZZER sounds again, even more insistently, and he cries out with frustration fury. But as the BUZZER continues, he reluctantly uncocks his gun, looking up angrily towards his front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, on a chain, and Clarice peers in, smiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon... I wonder if you  could help me. I'm looking for Mrs.  Lippman's family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gumb frowns out at Clarice. For the first time ever, get a well-lit view of his bland, pale-eyed moon of a fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't live here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "deliveryman" yanks a 12 lb. sledgehammer from the fl box, swings it with all his might against the door knob,  blowing it through as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawford and Burroughs race towards the door, guns up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gumb starts to close the door, only to have Clarice p back against it, politely but firmly. She holds up her ID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but I really do need to  talk to you. This was Mrs. Lippman's  house. Did you know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Just briefly. What's the problem,  Officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bedroom window disintegrates as a flash grenade is shot through it, EXPLODING on the floor. An instant later, a b clad HRT cop dives through the shattered glass, rolls acr the floor, comes up on one knee swiveling his sawed-off  shotgun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice and Mr. Gumb, still eyeing each other through the door crack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm investigating the death of  Fredrica Bimmel. Who are you, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gordon, did you know Fredrica  when she worked for Mrs. Lippman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Wait... Was she a great, fat  person? I may have seen her, I'm not  sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE as Burroughs moves quickly down a hallway an enters the living room, where Crawford is standing, with gun held down by his side, surrounded by several other co Burroughs shakes his head: Nothing here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gumb glances briefly over his shoulder, towards his  kitchen, then turns back to Clarice with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lippman had a son, maybe he  could help you. I have his card  somewhere. Do you mind stepping  inside, while I looks for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which rests on a counter, just inside the open kitchen  doorway. THROUGH this doorway, we watch as Mr. Gumb, at t end of his front hall, slips the chain. Clarice enters,  closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE - towards the front door, as frustrated HRT  cops file out of the empty house, rifles slung across the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: WE PICK OUT CRAWFORD
dialogues.text: walking across the grass towards the van, when all at onc he stops in his tracks, shaken by a sudden flash of intui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on his stricken face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice, pulling her notebook from her shoulder bag, glan around the musty-looking room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That horrible business, I shiver  every time I think about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overstuffed furniture, porcelain figurines. One archway o the front hall, another onto a dining alcove, and through there, the kitchen. Mr. Gumb is crossing to a rolling des raising the top. He bends over, begins poking through cub holes. His tone is casual, neutral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they close to catching somebody,  do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we may be, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gumb stiffens, almost imperceptibly. His back is to h as he continues opening drawers, rustling papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gordon, did you take over this  place after Mrs. Lippman died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I bought the house from her,  two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she leave any records here? Tax  or business records? Maybe a list of  employees?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB'S BACK
dialogues.text: as he continues his rummaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing at all. Has the FBI  learned something? Because the police  here don't seem to have the first  clue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the folds of his kimono crawls a Death's-head Moth It creeps slowly to the center of his back, raising its w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have his description yet, or  some fingerprints...?

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: unaware, is still glancing around the room. For several  agonizing moments, we think she won't see the moth - but  then she turns, does see it, and her eyes freeze. A beat pure fear. A tremendous struggle to keep her voice calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no, we don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very carefully, she drops her notebook back into her bag, lowers the bag to the floor. With her fingertips she brus back the edge of her blazer, loosening its drape.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: turns back towards her cheerfully, holding out a business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh. Here's that number.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: keeps her distance. They are about ten feet apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, thank you. Mr. Gordon, do you  have a phone I can use?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: is about to reply when the moth suddenly flies up from be him, flutters past his face. He turns, looking at it. He  looks back at Clarice, his mouth still open.

dialogues.speaker: HER EYES
dialogues.text: are unmoving, locked on his.

dialogues.speaker: HIS EYES
dialogues.text: stare back at her, widen. And they know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) In the kitchen. I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: whips her gun out, gripping it in both shaking hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: slowly tilts his head to one side, smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: tries to force more authority into her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Okay, Mr. Gumb, you're under  arrest. Down on the floor, hands and  legs spread, move it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: turns, then all at once, in two quick steps, he is gone,  disappearing into his dining alcove, then kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: hesitates, just a split second, to shoot him in the back and then it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice hurries inside, moving low, swivelling her gun.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING
dialogues.text: The kitchen is empty. To one side, a door still shudderin on its hinges...

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: rushes to this - pauses - then elbows the door aside, aim her gun down -

dialogues.speaker: AN EMPTY STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: brightly lit, leading to the cellar. Two doors facing the bottom, both open. No sign of Mr. Gumb.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: hates this, hates this, which door, it's a trap, what to she is very scared, but suddenly hears - The distant SCREAM of Catherine Martin, somewhere down th in that killing maze.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: rushes through the doorway, and down the stairs. BEHIND HER, ON THE KITCHEN COUNTER there's an empty space the Colt Python is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING ANGLE - WITH CLARICE - hurrying down the steps. Mo SCREAMS; they seem to be coming from the left door. Clari goes that way, entering a brick-walled passage - pipes ov head, naked bulbs. The lighting, though dim, is incandesc Mr. Gumb has switched off his infra-red system. Clarice c to a T-shaped intersection, stops. Another SCREAM, again her left, and the BARKING of a dog...

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: follows her gun around the corner, looking right.

dialogues.speaker: EMPTY PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: but doors opening off it - he could be lurking behind any them. She looks left... sees an opening onto some kind of chamber. The noises are LOUDER, coming from there.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: moves cautiously towards this chamber...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice moves in, hugging the wall, gun swivelling...

dialogues.speaker: MOVING
dialogues.text: the open top of the pit... beyond it, the other two doorw opening onto this room - Jesus, he could come through eit one of them, or come up behind her... She moves to the pi looks down, very briefly, sees Catherine SCREAMING,  hysterical, and a little white dog BARKING...

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: kneels, staring up from one door to another, she can't co them all, she's totally exposed - and what's a dog doing  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI, Catherine, you're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe, SHIT, he's got a gun! Getmeout. GET ME OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all right! Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you out! Just be quiet so I  can hear. Shut that dog up. (still swivelling) Is there a ladder? Is there a rope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! Get me out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine. Listen to me. I have to  find a rope. I have to leave this room, just for a minute, but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOO! You fucking bitch don't you  LEAVE ME down here, DON'T YOU - YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut UP! (then, louder) The other officers will be here any  minute! you're perfectly safe now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignoring Catherine, whose shouts turn to sobs, she backs  away, turns, picks one of the other doorways, moves into quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARICE'S POV - MOVING down this passageway, towards a ne room... pausing at the doorway, straining to hear... no s except Catherine's CRYING, not in the background, and  Clarice's own RAPID BREATHING. Then she crouches - LOWER ANGLE - bursts forward, through the doorframe,  sidestepping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice weaves back and forth, half-crouched, gun out, ba to the wall. Her face glistens with sweat, as she takes i

dialogues.speaker: MOVING NERVOUSLY
dialogues.text: Mr. Gumb's sewing machine... his swivel chair... the old  Victrola... Big moths are crashing into the light bulbs,  overhead; they're everywhere. Suddenly, from just behind  her, a CLICK and a HUM, and -

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: spins, almost shoots, before seeing -

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL REFRIGERATOR
dialogues.text: with its thermostat just switching ON.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: gasps for breath, fighting for calm. She turns again, sla her free hand at the moths, moving quickly on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice moves past the mannequins, all of them naked now. then quickly past the huge Chinese armoire, ready to shoo into it. Its doors yawn open; it is empty except for seve padded hangers... She moves on, past the big sink, with i DRIPPING faucet... the counter, with its gleaming knives. the rows of chemical jars. At the end of this room is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice starts to open it, then hesitates. Looking around she seizes a wooden chair, wedges it under the door know, sealing off this section of the cellar. With her back thu defended, she turns, softly retracing her steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing again through the workroom, Clarice pauses, seein half-curtained door, to one side, that she had previously skirted. She crosses to the door, listens and hears no so inside, takes a deep breath and reaches for the knob. She twists it, and, as it turns, shoves hard and follows her inside, all in one quick move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old-fashioned bathroom: tiled floor, sink, toilet - an big, free-standing tub. An opaque shower curtain, suspend from an oval ring, hides whatever might be inside.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: centers her gun on the curtain, at chest height, and yank it aside with her left hand. No one standing there. Somet lower down catches her eye. She leans in, stares more closely, not understanding, at  first, that she's seeing -

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE HAND AND WRIST
dialogues.text: sticking up from the tub, which is filled with hard red-p plaster. The hand is dark and shriveled, with pink nail p and a dainty wristwatch. As -

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: is reacting with horror to this sight, the lights go out, be replaced, a split-second later, by the eerie green glo of Mr. Gumb's infra-red system. Clarice cries out, turns  blindly, reaching for the door, can't find it, free hand  clawing desperately into what is, for her, utter darkness SOUND of Catherine KEENING again, in the far distance. Cl stumbles, goes to her knees, rights herself, finally clut the door frame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice emerges from the bathroom in a half-crouch, arms  out, both hands on the gun, extended just below the level her unseeing eyes. She stops, listens. In her raw-nerved  darkness, every SOUND is unnaturally magnified - the HUM the refrigerator... the TRICKLE of water... her own terri BREATHING, and Catherine's faraway, echoing SOBS... Moths smack against her face and arms. She eases forward, then  stops again, listens... She eases forward again, followin her gun, and creeps directly in front of, and then past -

dialogues.speaker: MR. GUMB
dialogues.text: who has flattened himself against a wall, arms spread lik high priest, Colt in one hand. He wears his goggles and  kimono, and under that - draping down over his naked arms like some hideous mantle - his terrifying, half-completed suit of human skins. This is an exquisite moment for him ritual of supreme exaltation. He smiles at Clarice as,  completely unaware, she moves beyond him, exposing her ba Very slowly and quietly he steps out behind her, taking h gun in both hands, aiming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Colt Python as - in SLOW MOTION - his thumbs cock the hammer, the SOUND registering as a LOUD METALLIC CLICK, a

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: spins, still in SLOW MOTION, flame already leaping from h gun muzzle, as we see -

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO FIGURES
dialogues.text: almost at point-black range, guns ROARING hugely, one FLA from Mr. Gumb, and one two three four FLASHES from Claric overlapping his, and then, as the ECHOES crash deafeningl

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: with NORMAL SPEED RESTORED, as the side of her face hits floor, and she is gasping, stunned by the noise and flame there is blood on her check, and an ugly powder burn, but she ignores them, twisting to yank her speedloader from h jacket pocket, locking it blindly onto her gun's cylinder reloading, right in front of her face, then rolling onto stomach, aiming her gun upward again, blinking her dazzle eyes, straining to locate him in the darkness... Where is he, where...? Then, as the ECHOES finally fade, she hears something else - a tortured, sucking, WHISTLE from perhap eight feet away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she crawls forward, on her elbows, following her gun,  until it bumps against Mr. Gumb's shoulder. He is lying o his back, chest a bloody mess. She slides her muzzle agai his head, hard, but he doesn't move; another shot isn't  needed. He stares upwards, through his goggles, bloody li working. He tries to speak, but cannot. One hand reaches  slowly upwards, the fingers twitching, as if to seize  something, overhead... Then a final, ghastly groan, his h drops, he is dead. Clarice feels for a pulse at his neck, making sure. Then, and only then, does she permit herself roll over, collapsing onto her back beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: down at the two faces - intimately close together, like l on their pillow. Then, as we PULL SLOWLY AWAY, we see tha her staring eyes, and his dead gaze, are both locked onto

dialogues.speaker: A DEATH'S-HEAD MOTH -
dialogues.text: perched on an infra-red bulb, overhead, its wings pumping slowly. SOUND UPCUT - wailing SIRENS, many excited VOICES, as we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front porch of the tall Victorian house is bathed in glare of TV lights, police and ambulance flashers. Cars a vans and even a firetruck choke the street; cops, reporte EMS workers and curious civilians swarm around the ineffe barricades. The BUZZ of their voices goes even higher as

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: dazed, her face bandaged - comes out of the house, walkin protectively beside Catherine, who is wheeled on a gurney They are followed out by uniformed cops, then two firemen with an extension ladder. Catherine, blinking in confusio is still clutching the little dog, and refuses to give he up even as she's trundled into an ambulance. Clarice sway with exhaustion; everyone seems to be shouting at her at  once, pulling her sleeve. She tries to fight free of them desperate for a familiar face.

dialogues.speaker: AN OHIO HIGHWAY PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: pulls up, stops, and Crawford climbs out of the back seat He makes his way anxiously through the press of bodies,  stopping when he sees Clarice.

dialogues.speaker: THEY LOOK AT ONE ANOTHER
dialogues.text: for a long moment, Crawford choked with pride for her, wi sorrow for her ordeal, with love, but unable to find any  words. And then he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starling... your father sees you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then all at once she is sobbing, her knees giving way but he is there to catch her, he is hugging her fiercely. HOLD ON them for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Congratulations! You are now officers  of the Federal Bureau of  Investigation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forty members of Clarice's class, resplendent in thei best dark suits and dresses, rise, cheering themselves, t turn happily to wave to their audience, as APPLAUSE mount Beyond them, on a gaily tented platform, the Director sta behind his podium.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE AND ARDELIA
dialogues.text: look at one another solemnly. Ardelia holds up both fists in a power shake, and Clarice taps them with her own. She radiantly beautiful in a navy dress and pearls, the thin  scar on her cheek almost healed. Ardelia turns, waving to the crowd, the Clarice's thoughts are elsewhere. She turn searching among the dignitaries on the platform, till she locates

dialogues.speaker: CRAWFORD
dialogues.text: who smiles back at her with quiet pride, and offers a lit salute.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: grins - more happy than we've ever seen her - then turns wave towards the crowd with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: over the admiring sea of spectators, several hundred of t still rising from their folding chairs, APPLAUDING in  celebration of these special young people, this perfect,  sunlit day. SOUND UPCUT - rock music, laughter - as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOUD party is underway - food, beer, dancing - as the n grads celebrate ferociously. Ardelia weaves her way throu the crowded room, reaches Clarice, who is flanked by her  special guests - Pilcher and Roden, the two ardent scient Ardelia has to shout at Clarice over the din.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Starling! Telephone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Agent Mapp! Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods to Pilcher, leaves them. Roden, who is quite hap drunk, grabs the startled Ardelia around the waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hel-lo, gorgeous! Let's get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ardelia looks at Pilcher, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ignore him. He's not a Ph.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarice picks up the dangling pay phone, speaks happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Clarice, have the lambs stopped  screaming...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She freezes, stunned by the familiar voice. Then she turn waving frantically towards

dialogues.speaker: ARDELIA
dialogues.text: who is just inside the rec room door, at the end of the h lost in conversation with Pilcher and Roden. Ardelia glan at her briefly but misunderstands, waves cheerfully back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother with a trace, I won't  be on long enough.

dialogues.speaker: CLARICE
dialogues.text: turns back, gripping the phone more tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, Dr. Lecter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very beautiful, glittering with countless stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I have a view, Clarice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see a rolling lawn, a curving bay. Boats ride at ancho lights shimmering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orion is looking splendid tonight,  and Arcturus, the Herdsman, with his  flock...

dialogues.speaker: DR. LECTER
dialogues.text: smiles into his mobile phone. He is stretched out on a  lounger, on a tiled patio, languidly paring an orange wit penknife. His appearance is quite altered - a beard, glas lighter hair. He's has some cosmetic surgery, as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Your lambs are still for now, Clarice,  but not forever... You'll have to  earn it again and again, this blessed  silence. Because it's the plight  that drives you, and the plight will  never end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Lecter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no plans to call on you,  Clarice, the world being more  interesting with you in it. Be sure  you extend me the same courtesy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't make that promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Clarice... (and then, softly) You looked - so very lovely today,  in your blue suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Clarice reacts, the fill weight of his words sinking i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Lecter... Dr. Lecter...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But only a DIAL TONE comes from the phone. She is still  staring at her receiver, in shock, as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Lecter sighs, sets his phone down, then rises. Poppin an orange section into his mouth, he turns towards the  brightly lit house. Stepping delicately over the sprawled body of a uniformed security guard, he walks in through o french doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a swivel chair, amidst the wreckage of his papers and  books, is the writhing figure of Dr. Frederick Chilton. T extreme intricacy of his bindings recalls Dr. Lecter's ow former restraints. His screams are muffled by the tape ov his mouth; he stares at Dr. Lecter like a rabbit trapped headlights.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LECTER
dialogues.text: Considers him for a genial moment, then raises the little pen-knife. His eyes are twinkling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dr. Chilton. Shall we begin?
